intro: Racosperma mallocladum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces yellow flowers in spikes, which are typical of the genus. Racosperma mallocladum is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
